byline.contributor: Jodi Rudoren contributed reporting from Jerusalem.

abstract: Assistants to Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu say they are not being informed of details as United States engages in talks with Iran over nuclear deal; US denies allegations.
lead_paragraph: Aides to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu say they are being kept in the dark about details of the nuclear negotiations, but American officials say that is not true.

headline.main: Fear of Israeli Leaks Fuels Distrust Over U.S. Talks With Iran
headline.print_headline: Fear of Israeli Leaks Fuels Distrust as U.S. and Iran Hold Nuclear Talks

snippet: Aides to Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu say they are being kept in the dark about details of the nuclear negotiations, but American officials say that is not true.
